author: Kalpesh
content: Indian automaker Tata Motors said on Thursday it will raise prices of its commercial vehicles by up to 2% from April 1 to offset the residual impact of past input costs. Earlier this week, Tata Motors said it will split into two listed companies, separating its CV business from its passenger vehicle arm.
title: India's Tata Motors to hike commercial vehicle prices by up to 2%

author: Mohul
content: The sighting of the new Ford Endeavour in India signals its impending debut. With plans for local assembly and competitive pricing, Ford aims to secure a significant foothold in the Indian SUV market, intensifying competition in the segment. Additionally, Ford plans to bring eight new models to India, including the Mustang GT and Mustang Mach-E, although higher prices are expected.
title: All new Ford Endeavour spotted during transportation in India

author: Debaroti Adhikary
content: Elon Musk on Thursday reposted a video showing Tesla's Cybertruck manoeuvring through 'Hell's Revenge' trail in US. The trail is considered one of the most difficult trails to cover due to its hazardous terrain. US government's Bureau of Land Management recommends it only for "very experienced drivers". The video shows Cybertruck driving at steep angles and passing through valley-like terrain.
title: Musk shares video of Cybertruck on 'Hell's Revenge' trail in US

author: Debaroti Adhikary
content: After a Tesla Cybertruck crashed into Beverly Hills Hotel sign in Los Angeles, CEO Elon Musk said the driver perhaps was not expecting "so much acceleration". "Cyberbeast is faster than a Porsche 911, but looks like a truck, so perhaps the valet wasnâ€™t expecting," he said. A picture showing the crash scene went viral on social media.
title: Faster than Porsche: Musk after Cybertruck rams into sign board

author: Kalpesh
content: Automobile stocks were trading higher on the BSE, as the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) in its latest data has showed that automobile retail sales in India rose 13 per cent year on year in February 2024 with all the segments, including passenger vehicles and two-wheelers, witnessing robust offtake.
title: Automobile stocks ride high amid growth in February retail sales

author: Kalpesh
content: The Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) in its latest data has showed that automobile retail sales in India rose 13 per cent year on year in February 2024 with all the segments, including passenger vehicles and two-wheelers, witnessing robust offtake. Overall retail sales stood at 20,29,541 units in February 2024 as compared to 17,94,866 units in the year-ago period.
title: Automobile retail sales in India rise 13% in February: FADA

author: Usha Kunji
content: A Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. promoter entity plans to pare its stake in the automaker by offering 0.75% equity in the secondary market for Rs 1,832 crore. Prudential Management and Services Pvt. has offered to sell up to 93 lakh shares in the Mahindra Group company. The price range for the sale of shares is Rs 1,911.5-1,970.65 apiece,
title: M&M promoter to sell stake worth up to Rs 1,832 crore

author: Swati Dubey
content: A study by Emission Analytics stated electric vehicles (EVs) emit more particulate matter from their brakes and tyres than gas-powered cars. The emission could be 1,850 times greater. The research attributed this to heavier weight of EVs, leading to faster deterioration of tyres, mostly made of synthetic rubber derived from crude oil, leading to release of harmful chemicals in air.
title: EVs emit more particulate matter than gas-powered cars: Study

author: Mohul
content: MMRDA approves the introduction of pod taxis along an 8.8-kilometer stretch between Bandra and Kurla via BKC to alleviate traffic congestion. The driverless pod taxi system, already operational globally, promises efficient connectivity for commuters with 38 planned stops and a speed of 40 kmph.
title: 6-seater elevated pod taxis approved between Bandra-Kurla

author: Mohul
content: In February 2024, Tata Motors surpassed Hyundai Motor India in monthly sales of passenger vehicles (PVs), with Tata selling 51,267 units compared to Hyundai's 50,201. Tata's best sales month, January 2024, saw 53,633 units sold. Tata's upcoming launch of the Curvv, featuring gasoline, diesel, and all-electric versions, highlights its push for EVs.
title: Tata beats Hyundai, again, to become India's 2nd biggest car maker
